feed.title: Google Cloud: Security Command Center
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Security Command Center

entry.content: Bulk export findings to BigQuery is available in General Availability. Bulk exports are supported for organizations, projects, and folders.
entry.summary: You can now bulk export findings to BigQuery. This feature is supported for organizations, projects, and folders.
entry.title: Feature: Bulk export findings to BigQuery

entry.content:
The upgraded model for the prompt injection and jailbreak detection filter is available in EU multi-region. This model has improved detection rates across several attack vectors, including the following:

  • Do Anything Now prompts
  • System instruction manipulation
  • Unauthorized action execution
  • Sensitive information retrieval
entry.summary: A new, upgraded model for prompt injection and jailbreak detection is now available in the EU multi-region. This model offers improved detection rates for various attack vectors.
entry.title: Changed: Upgraded prompt injection and jailbreak detection model now available

entry.content: Graph search lets you explore the security graph using custom queries. This product is available in Preview in the Security Command Center Enterprise tier.
entry.summary: Explore your security data with custom queries using Graph Search, now in Preview for Security Command Center Enterprise users.
entry.title: Feature: Graph Search for Security Insights

entry.content: Model Armor is integrated with Google Agentspace to provide greater insights and enhanced security of your agent interactions by default. For more information, see Integration with Google Agentspace.
entry.summary: Model Armor now integrates with Google Agentspace, offering enhanced security and insights into agent interactions by default.
entry.title: Feature: Model Armor and Agentspace Integration

entry.content: Model Armor integration with Google Kubernetes Engine is available in General Availability.
entry.summary: Model Armor integration with Google Kubernetes Engine is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Model Armor now available for GKE

entry.content:
The Findings page in Security Command Center has been improved.

  • With Security Command Center Premium and Enterprise, the page includes the following predefined filter views that return a specific category of findings.

  • Premium service tier: All Findings, Vulnerabilities, Identity, and Threats.

  • Enterprise service tier: All Findings, Vulnerabilities, Identity, Data, and Code.
  • With Security Command Center Enterprise, the page includes a selector to filter by cloud provider: Google Cloud, Amazon Web Service (AWS), and Microsoft Azure.

For more information, see Review and manage findings.
entry.summary: The Findings page in Security Command Center has been updated with new predefined filter views for Premium and Enterprise users, including options for All Findings, Vulnerabilities, Identity, Threats, Data, and Code. The Enterprise tier also adds a cloud provider filter for Google Cloud, AWS, and Azure.
entry.title: Changed: Security Command Center Findings Page Updates

entry.content:
Security Command Center has improved the automatic selection of resources when running attack path simulations using the default high-value resource set.

Risk Engine uses heuristics to identify resources used for non-production purposes. To help ensure that you have information about the most important assets, Risk Engine calculates the attack exposure score for all other resources in the default high-value resource set before calculating the attack exposure score for these non-production resources.

To customize the high-value resource set, see Define and manage your high-value resource set. For information about Risk Engine, see Attack exposure scores and attack paths.
entry.summary: Security Command Center now offers enhanced automatic selection of resources for attack path simulations by refining the default high-value resource set. This update improves the accuracy of attack exposure scoring for critical assets.
entry.title: Changed: Improved resource selection for attack path simulations

entry.content: Security Command Center changed how Google Cloud subnets are handled when running attack path simulations. The result is that attack paths are more accurate in relation to networking. Certain customers with specific Google Cloud subnet configurations, for example, when a VPC connector accesses a subnetwork, may see significant changes to toxic combinations, chokepoints, and attack exposure scores.
entry.summary: Attack path accuracy improved for Google Cloud subnets in Security Command Center. Customers with specific configurations may see changes in exposure scores.
entry.title: Changed: Security Command Center subnet handling updated

entry.content: Assured Open Source Software (Assured OSS) now supports Go packages. For more information, see Download Go packages using direct repository access.
entry.summary: Assured Open Source Software now supports Go packages, allowing for direct repository access downloads.
entry.title: Feature: Go Packages Now Supported by Assured OSS

entry.content: Cloud Run Threat Detection is available in General Availability.
entry.summary: We're happy to announce that Cloud Run Threat Detection is now available in General Availability. This feature helps you secure your Cloud Run services by detecting and alerting on potential threats.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Run Threat Detection Now Generally Available

entry.content: The Model Armor monitoring dashboard provides a centralized view to track interactions and violations within your projects. This feature is available in Preview. For more information, see View the monitoring dashboard.
entry.summary: A new dashboard is available to track interactions and violations.
entry.title: Feature: Model Armor Monitoring Dashboard

entry.content:
Multiple pages in Security Command Center Premium have been improved:

  • The Risk overview page is enhanced to provide a view of threats, vulnerabilities, and misconfigurations.
  • The Findings page includes predefined filter views for vulnerabilities and identity findings.
  • Information previously on the Threats page is available in the Threats dashboard on the Risk overview page.
  • Information previously on the Vulnerabilities page is now available on the Vulnerabilities dashboard on the Risk overview page.
entry.summary: Key pages in Security Command Center Premium have been updated to offer a more integrated view of security posture. The Risk overview page now includes enhanced dashboards for threats, vulnerabilities, and misconfigurations. Additionally, the Findings page features new predefined filters for easier analysis of security data.
entry.title: Changed: Security Command Center Premium Updates

entry.content: Vulnerability assessment for Google Cloud supports scanning disks configured with customer-managed encryption keys (CMEK) for projects that are outside of VPC Service Controls perimeters. For more information about how to scan disks configured with CMEK, see Run Vulnerability Scans for CMEK disks.
entry.summary: Vulnerability assessment now supports scanning disks encrypted with customer-managed encryption keys (CMEK), even for projects outside of VPC Service Controls perimeters.
entry.title: Feature: Vulnerability Assessment for CMEK Disks

entry.content: Compliance Manager (available in Preview) now lets you remove resources from deployed frameworks.
entry.summary: Compliance Manager now allows you to remove resources from deployed frameworks.
entry.title: Changed: Compliance Manager: Resource Removal

entry.content: Issues, chokepoints (for Google Cloud), and predefined security graph rules have been released to General Availability.
entry.summary: Issues, chokepoints, and predefined security graph rules are now generally available.
entry.title: Changed: Security Command Center Updates

entry.content: AI Protection helps you manage the security posture of your AI workloads by detecting threats and helping you to mitigate risks to your AI asset inventory. This product is available in Preview to the Security Command Center Enterprise tier.
entry.summary: AI Protection helps manage AI security posture by detecting threats and mitigating risks.
entry.title: Feature: AI Protection for Enhanced Security

entry.content: You can use customer-managed encryption keys (CMEKs) to protect data at rest in Security Command Center. This feature is available in General Availability. For more information, see Enable CMEK for Security Command Center.
entry.summary: Customer-managed encryption keys (CMEK) are now available for Security Command Center, offering enhanced data protection for data at rest.
entry.title: Feature: CMEK Now Available for Security Command Center

entry.content: Data Security Posture Management (DSPM) lets you define, deploy, monitor, and audit data security postures for your Google Cloud environment. This product is available in Preview to the Security Command Center Enterprise tier.
entry.summary: A new feature for managing data security in Google Cloud.
entry.title: Feature: New Data Security Feature

entry.content: Risk reports generated and downloaded from Security Command Center include a system attack exposure page that shows the organization's exposure risk over time and lists the projects and resources that have the highest risk.
entry.summary: Risk reports now show your organization's exposure risk over time and highlight high-risk projects and resources.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature: Enhanced Risk Reporting

entry.content:
The following Container Threat Detection detectors have been released to General Availability:

  • Execution: Possible Arbitrary Command Execution through CUPS (CVE-2024-47177)
  • Execution: Socat Reverse Shell Detected
  • Privilege Escalation: Abuse of Sudo For Privilege Escalation (CVE-2019-14287)
  • Privilege Escalation: Polkit Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability (CVE-2021-4034)
  • Privilege Escalation: Sudo Potential Privilege Escalation (CVE-2021-3156)
entry.summary: New container threat detection features are now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: New Container Threat Detection Features Released

entry.content: Model Armor supports the asia-southeast1 location. For information about supported locations, see Locations for the Model Armor API.
entry.summary: Model Armor now supports asia-southeast1.
entry.title: Changed: Model Armor Location Update

entry.content: Compliance Manager helps ensure that your Google Cloud infrastructure, workloads, and data meet the security and regulatory requirements of your organization. This product is available in Preview to the Security Command Center Enterprise tier.
entry.summary: Compliance Manager helps ensure your Google Cloud infrastructure meets security and regulatory requirements.
entry.title: Feature: Compliance Manager Overview

entry.content:
Model Armor and Vertex AI integration

Model Armor integrates with Vertex AI, providing a default security configuration for all new prediction endpoints. This feature is in Preview. For more information, see Integration with Vertex AI.
entry.summary: Model Armor integrates with Vertex AI for enhanced security.
entry.title: Feature: Model Armor and Vertex AI Integration

entry.content: You can send a bulk export of Security Command Center findings to a BigQuery dataset. This feature is available in Preview. For more information, see Bulk export findings to BigQuery.
entry.summary: Send Security Command Center findings to BigQuery.
entry.title: Feature: Bulk export findings

entry.content: You can use Terraform to manage Model Armor floor settings and templates. This helps reduce manual overhead with Model Armor deployments. For more information, see Terraform resources for Security Command Center.
entry.summary: Manage Model Armor settings with Terraform.
entry.title: Feature: Terraform for Model Armor

entry.content:
Model Armor filter updates

  • The prompt injection and jailbreak detection filter now supports 10,000 tokens.
  • For the Sensitive Data Protection filter, SKIP_DETECTION is returned if the prompt or response exceeds the token limit.
  • For all other filters, if the prompt or response exceeds the token limit, MATCH_FOUND is returned if malicious content is found, and SKIP_DETECTION is returned if no malicious content is found.
entry.summary: Model Armor filter updates: prompt injection and jailbreak detection filter now supports 10,000 tokens.
entry.title: Changed: Model Armor Filter Update

entry.content: Cloud Infrastructure Entitlement Management (CIEM) has launched support for log ingestion from Microsoft Azure management groups. This capability lets users set up log ingestion and then consume findings at an Azure management group level, rather than at the subscription level. For more information, see Configure Microsoft Azure log ingestion for management groups. This capability is available in Preview.
entry.summary: CIEM now supports log ingestion from Azure management groups.
entry.title: Changed: CIEM Azure Log Ingestion Update

entry.content: A new risk scoring algorithm is launched. As a result, you might see slight changes in attack exposure scores for resources and findings. The new algorithm better reflects attacker behavior and gives a fairer representation of the relative risk level of your organization. We will monitor the results of this change and might perform further adjustments, if necessary.
entry.summary: New risk scoring algorithm launched. Attack exposure scores may change slightly. The new algorithm better reflects attacker behavior and risk.
entry.title: Changed: Risk Scoring Algorithm Update

entry.content: For the Enterprise service tier, Security Command Center offers data residency support in the European Union, Saudi Arabia, and United States. This feature is in General Availability.
entry.summary: Security Command Center now offers data residency support in the EU, Saudi Arabia, and United States for the Enterprise service tier.
entry.title: Feature: Data Residency Support for Security Command Center

entry.content: The Setup guide in Security Command Center Enterprise, used to monitor the activation progress and configure services, is now in General Availability.
entry.summary: Setup guide for Security Command Center Enterprise is now in General Availability.
entry.title: Changed: Security Command Center Enterprise Setup Guide Now GA

entry.content: The Impair Defenses: Two Step Verification Disabled finding type of Event Threat Detection was renamed to Persistence: Two Step Verification Disabled. For a complete list of Event Threat Detection finding types, see Event Threat Detection overview.
entry.summary: Two Step Verification Disabled finding type renamed.
entry.title: Changed: Finding Type Change

entry.content: The Aggregations panel on the Findings page in Security Command Center Enterprise has been enhanced and is now called Quick Filters. For information about filtering results on the Findings page, see Review and manage findings.
entry.summary: The Aggregations panel in Security Command Center Enterprise Findings page has been renamed to Quick Filters. For more details on filtering, refer to the documentation on reviewing and managing findings.
entry.title: Changed: Aggregations panel renamed to Quick Filters

entry.content:
The following Container Threat Detection detectors for file monitoring are in Preview:

  • Collection: Pam.d Modification
  • Credential Access: Access Sensitive Files on Nodes
  • Defense Evasion: Disable or modify Linux audit system
  • Defense Evasion: Root Certificate Installed
  • Execution: Suspicious Cron Modification
  • Persistence: Modify ld.so.preload
entry.summary: New detectors for file monitoring are available in preview, including Pam.d Modification, Credential Access, Defense Evasion, Execution, and Persistence.
entry.title: Feature: Container Threat Detection detectors now in preview

entry.content:
The following Security Command Center Enterprise pages in the Google Cloud console now fully replace equivalent pages that you accessed previously in the Google Security Operations console.

  • Risk Overview
  • Issues
  • Assets (previously called Resources)
  • Findings

Left navigation links in the Google Security Operations console open the related Google Cloud console page. See the earlier release announcement about these pages.
entry.summary: The Google Security Operations console has been updated, and its functionalities are now fully integrated into the Google Cloud console. Key pages such as Risk Overview, Issues, Assets, and Findings have been moved and replaced within the Google Cloud console. Links from the Security Operations console now direct users to the corresponding pages in Google Cloud.
entry.title: Changed: Security Operations console now part of Google Cloud console

entry.content: In the Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) security posture dashboard, the software vulnerabilities pane is available in Preview, not General Availability.
entry.summary: The software vulnerabilities pane in the Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) security posture dashboard is now available in Preview. This update allows users to access and evaluate software vulnerabilities within their GKE environments.
entry.title: Changed: GKE Security Dashboard Vulnerability Pane in Preview

entry.content:
Notebook Security Scanner is a built-in package vulnerability detection service of Security Command Center. This feature is available in Preview to the Security Command Center Premium or Enterprise tier.

You can enable and use Notebook Security Scanner to detect vulnerabilities in Python packages that are used in Colab Enterprise notebooks (files with the ipynb filename extension) and resolve those package vulnerability findings.
entry.summary: A new feature is available for Security Command Center Premium or Enterprise users. The Notebook Security Scanner helps detect vulnerabilities in Python packages used in Colab Enterprise notebooks, allowing you to resolve package security issues.
entry.title: Feature: New Notebook Security Scanner Available

entry.content: In the Google Cloud console, the Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) security posture dashboard shows the top software vulnerabilities that affect your GKE workloads. This feature is in General Availability.
entry.summary: The GKE security posture dashboard in the Google Cloud console now shows the top software vulnerabilities affecting your GKE workloads. This feature has reached General Availability.
entry.title: Changed: GKE Security Posture Dashboard Update

entry.content:
Security Command Center now supports the detection of Chokepoints for the following cloud service provider platforms:

  • Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • Microsoft Azure

Support for Chokepoints with Microsoft Azure and AWS is in Preview.
entry.summary: Security Command Center now detects Chokepoints for AWS and Azure, with support currently in Preview.
entry.title: Changed: Chokepoint Detection Now Available for AWS and Azure

entry.content: You can download risk reports as PDFs. Risk reports help you understand the results of the attack path simulations (virtual red teaming) that Security Command Center runs. This feature is in Preview and is available for customers on the Enterprise or Premium service tiers. For more information, see Risk reports overview.
entry.summary: You can now download risk reports as PDFs to understand your attack path simulation results. This feature is available in Preview for Enterprise and Premium service tiers.
entry.title: Feature: Downloadable Risk Reports Available

entry.content:
The following Virtual Machine Threat Detection detectors are in General Availability.

  • Defense Evasion: Unexpected ftrace handler
  • Defense Evasion: Unexpected interrupt handler
  • Defense Evasion: Unexpected kernel modules
  • Defense Evasion: Unexpected kernel read-only data modification
  • Defense Evasion: Unexpected kprobe handler
  • Defense Evasion: Unexpected processes in runqueue
  • Defense Evasion: Unexpected system call handler
entry.summary: We are pleased to announce that our Virtual Machine Threat Detection feature is now in General Availability. This feature includes several new detectors for enhanced security.
entry.title: Feature: Virtual Machine Threat Detection Now Generally Available

entry.content: The Defense Evasion: Unexpected kernel code modification detector of Virtual Machine Threat Detection is shut down. For more information, see Detector shutdowns.
entry.summary: The Defense Evasion: Unexpected kernel code modification detector in Virtual Machine Threat Detection has been shut down. For more information, please refer to the detector shutdowns documentation.
entry.title: Deprecated: Virtual Machine Threat Detection detector shut down

entry.content:
The following Event Threat Detection detectors have been released to GA.

  • Exfiltration: Cloud SQL Data Exfiltration
  • Credential Access: CloudDB Failed login from Anonymizing Proxy IP
  • Initial Access: CloudDB Successful login from Anonymizing Proxy IP
entry.summary: Three new Event Threat Detection detectors are now generally available, including Cloud SQL Data Exfiltration and detectors for anonymizing proxy IP addresses targeting CloudDB.
entry.title: Changed: New Event Threat Detection detectors released

entry.content:
The display name for the following Event Threat Detection rules have changed. Please update any artifacts that use these values, such as finding filters, finding queries, or mute rules.

| Previous display name | New display name | | --- | --- | | Defensive Evasion: Static Pod Created | Defense Evasion: Static Pod Created | | Data Destruction: Deleted Google Cloud Backup and DR Backup | Impact: Deleted Google Cloud Backup and DR Backup | | Inhibit System Recovery: Deleted Google Cloud Backup and DR host | Impact: Deleted Google Cloud Backup and DR host | | Inhibit System Recovery: Deleted Google Cloud Backup and DR plan association | Impact: Deleted Google Cloud Backup and DR plan association | | Inhibit System Recovery: Deleted Google Cloud Backup and DR Vault | Impact: Deleted Google Cloud Backup and DR Vault | | Inhibit System Recovery: Google Cloud Backup and DR delete policy | Impact: Google Cloud Backup and DR delete policy | | Inhibit System Recovery: Google Cloud Backup and DR delete profile | Impact: Google Cloud Backup and DR delete profile | | Inhibit System Recovery: Google Cloud Backup and DR delete storage pool | Impact: Google Cloud Backup and DR delete storage pool | | Inhibit System Recovery: Google Cloud Backup and DR delete template | Impact: Google Cloud Backup and DR delete template | | Data Destruction: Google Cloud Backup and DR expire image | Impact: Google Cloud Backup and DR expire image | | Data Destruction: Google Cloud Backup and DR remove appliance | Impact: Google Cloud Backup and DR remove appliance | | Inhibit System Recovery: Google Cloud Backup and DR remove plan | Impact: Google Cloud Backup and DR remove plan | | Impair Defenses: Strong Authentication Disabled | Persistence: Strong Authentication Disabled | | Credential Access: External Member Added To Privileged Group | Privilege Escalation: External Member Added To Privileged Group | | Persistence: Impersonation Role Granted For Dormant Service Account | Privilege Escalation: Impersonation Role Granted For Dormant Service Account | | Credential Access: Privileged Group Opened To Public | Privilege Escalation: Privileged Group Opened To Public | | Credential Access: Sensitive Role Granted To Hybrid Group | Privilege Escalation: Sensitive Role Granted To Hybrid Group |
entry.summary: The display names for several Event Threat Detection rules have been updated. Please review and update any artifacts that reference these display names, such as filters, queries, or mute rules.
entry.title: Changed: Event Threat Detection rule display names updated

entry.content: Risk Engine includes the aiplatform.googleapis.com/Model resource type in the default high-value resource set. For more information, see the list of default resource types.
entry.summary: The Risk Engine now includes the `aiplatform.googleapis.com/Model` resource type in its default high-value resource set, enhancing its ability to identify and prioritize critical assets. For more details, refer to the updated list of default resource types.
entry.title: Changed: Risk Engine resource set updated

entry.content: The prompt injection and jailbreak detection filter in Model Armor flags more threats across various attack vectors, and offers an improved detection rate for high-confidence malicious prompts. This filter is available in us-east1.
entry.summary: The prompt injection and jailbreak detection filter in Model Armor now identifies more threats, including a better detection rate for high-confidence malicious prompts. This feature is available in us-east1.
entry.title: Changed: Improved threat detection in Model Armor

entry.content:
CVEs with no known exploitation activity are not considered in attack path simulations

Vulnerability findings in Security Command Center are enriched by Mandiant Threat Intelligence. A CVE with wide exploitation activity is more likely to be used in an attack path compared to a CVE with only anticipated exploitation activity. Vulnerabilities with no known exploitation activity are not considered in attack path simulations. For more information, see Incorporation of CVE data.
entry.summary: Vulnerability findings are enriched by Mandiant Threat Intelligence. Only CVEs with known exploitation are included in attack path simulations, as they pose a higher risk.
entry.title: Changed: CVEs in Attack Path Simulations

entry.content: The Set security marks option in the new Security Command Center Enterprise Findings and Assets pages is temporarily unavailable. You can opt-out of the new Security Command Center Enterprise experience to manage security marks using the Cloud console. Or, you can manage security marks using the Security Command Center API.
entry.summary: The "Set security marks" feature is temporarily unavailable in the new Security Command Center Enterprise Findings and Assets pages. Users can manage security marks through the Cloud console by opting out of the new experience or by using the Security Command Center API.
entry.title: Announcement: Security Marks Feature Temporarily Unavailable

entry.content:
The following Event Threat Detection detectors for Vertex AI have been released to Preview:

  • Persistence: New Geography for AI Service
  • Privilege Escalation: Anomalous Multistep Service Account Delegation for AI Admin Activity
  • Privilege Escalation: Anomalous Multistep Service Account Delegation for AI Data Access
  • Privilege Escalation: Anomalous Service Account Impersonator for AI Admin Activity
  • Privilege Escalation: Anomalous Service Account Impersonator for AI Data Access
  • Privilege Escalation: Anomalous Impersonation of Service Account for AI Admin Activity
  • Persistence: New AI API Method
  • Initial Access: Dormant Service Account Activity in AI Service
entry.summary: New detectors for Vertex AI are now available in preview, enhancing Event Threat Detection capabilities.
entry.title: Feature: New Vertex AI detectors for Event Threat Detection

entry.content:
Model Armor supports screening text in the following document types for malicious content.

  • DOCX, DOCM, DOTX, DOTM documents
  • PPTX, PPTM, POTX, POT presentations
  • XLSX, XLSM, XLTX, XLTM spreadsheets
entry.summary: Model Armor now screens DOCX, DOCM, DOTX, DOTM documents, PPTX, PPTM, POTX, POTM presentations, and XLSX, XLSM, XLTX, XLTM spreadsheets for malicious content.
entry.title: Feature: Model Armor now screens more document types

entry.content:
Multi-language support for Model Armor filters

The Responsible AI and prompt injection and jailbreak detection filters are tested in English, Spanish, French, Italian, Portuguese, German, Chinese (Mandarin), Japanese, and Korean. These filters can work in other languages, but the quality of results might vary.

For more information, see Languages supported.
entry.summary: The new update includes multi-language support for Model Armor filters, which have been tested in multiple languages including English, Spanish, French, German, and more. While the filters may work in other languages, the quality of results may vary.
entry.title: Feature: Multi-language Support for Model Armor Filters

entry.content: The Security Risk Overview dashboard for Compute Engine is in General Availability. In addition, it provides a Top CVE findings table that lists the most severe CVEs that affect your Compute Engine instances.
entry.summary: The Security Risk Overview dashboard for Compute Engine is now generally available. This update includes a new table listing the most severe CVE findings affecting your Compute Engine instances.
entry.title: Changed: Security Risk Overview dashboard for Compute Engine now available

entry.content: Vulnerability Assessment for Google Cloud supports scanning on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) nodes and containers. This feature has been released to Preview.
entry.summary: Vulnerability Assessment now supports scanning of Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) nodes and containers. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Vulnerability Assessment for GKE

entry.content: Muted findings are no longer considered in the Security Command Center Risk Engine. As a result, they no longer get attack exposure scores.
entry.summary: Muted findings are no longer evaluated by the Security Command Center Risk Engine, meaning they will not receive attack exposure scores.
entry.title: Changed: Muted findings no longer impact risk score

entry.content: Security Command Center Premium customers can now access toxic combinations, which are in General Availability, and chokepoints, which are in Preview. These are available at the organization level. For more information, see Toxic combinations and chokepoints overview.
entry.summary: Security Command Center Premium now offers toxic combinations in General Availability and chokepoints in Preview, both accessible at the organization level.
entry.title: Feature: New Security Features Available

entry.content:
The following Container Threat Detection detectors for Google Kubernetes Engine have been released to General Availability:

  • Credential Access: Find Google Cloud Credentials
  • Credential Access: GPG Key Reconnaissance
  • Defense Evasion: Base64 ELF File Command Line
  • Defense Evasion: Base64 Encoded Python Script Executed
  • Defense Evasion: Base64 Encoded Shell Script Executed
  • Execution: Fileless Execution in /memfd:
  • Execution: Suspicious OpenSSL Shared Object Loaded
  • Privilege Escalation: Fileless Execution in /dev/shm
entry.summary: Container Threat Detection for Google Kubernetes Engine now offers 8 new detectors for enhanced security, including Credential Access, Defense Evasion, Execution, and Privilege Escalation.
entry.title: Feature: New detectors for Container Threat Detection

entry.content:
Domain tagging for toxic combinations and chokepoints has been improved to be more precise. The following filters are available for issues:

  • CVE Vulnerabilities
  • Identity
  • Data
  • AI Security
entry.summary: Domain tagging for toxic combinations and chokepoints has been improved for greater precision. New filters for issues include CVE Vulnerabilities, Identity, Data, and AI Security.
entry.title: Changed: Improved Domain Tagging and New Issue Filters

entry.content:
Model Armor enhancements

  • Model Armor supports multi-regional endpoints. For more information, see Locations for the Model Armor API.
  • All Model Armor filters support up to 2,000 tokens.
entry.summary: Model Armor now supports multi-regional endpoints and all filters support up to 2,000 tokens.
entry.title: Changed: Model Armor enhancements

entry.content: Enhanced data residency support in the European Union and United States is in General Availability.
entry.summary: Data residency support has been enhanced in the EU and US, and is now generally available.
entry.title: Changed: Enhanced data residency support
